message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CV 

This paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it discusses a technique for improving a policy in a reinforcement learning setting. It also involves the combination of two popular reinforcement learning algorithms, policy gradient and Q-learning, which are commonly used in machine learning research. Additionally, the paper includes numerical examples that demonstrate improved data efficiency and stability, which are important considerations in machine learning research. 

The paper could also potentially belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, as reinforcement learning is a subfield of AI. 

The robotics (cs.RO) sub-category is also a possibility, as reinforcement learning is commonly used in robotics research to train robots to perform tasks. 

Computer vision (cs.CV) is another potential sub-category, as the paper mentions testing the technique on the full suite of Atari games, which often involve visual input. 

Finally, the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category is a possibility, as the paper discusses using Q-learning to estimate Q-values, which are commonly used in control theory.
